title: Drawing, "Sketches from Ecuador a. View of the Purese.  b. The Sincholagua.", August 9 and September 1853
medium: Graphite, brush and white gouache on greenish-gray paper
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite, at top:  The upper part of the volcano was / concealed by the smoke which was drawn down before the summit and created a  / pleasing effect, the vaprous modulatins / etc. of the / top turn into the first part of the book.; and at bottom right to left of the peak: Sinchuglagua [followed by the date].
description: Horizontal view of the lower part of the Volcano of Purese shown across the mountain ranges at top, and the  snow covered peak of Mt. Sincholagua at bottom right.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Sketches from Ecuador a. View of the Purese.  b. The Sincholagua.", August 9 and September 1853.
August 9 and September 1853. Graphite, brush and white gouache on greenish-gray paper. Gift of Louis P. Church. 1917-4-126.
